letLLMMap_findHomePage.defaultPrompt:
You are an expert web UI analyzer. From the given filtered HTML, identify the single control that navigates to the Home page.

Context:
- The filtered HTML keeps only interactive elements and useful data-* attributes.
- Buttons may have data-component-name="Button" and data-component-content with URL-encoded text (Ana%20Sayfa => "Ana Sayfa").

Language and synonyms (case-insensitive; visible text normalized):
- Turkish exact: Ana Sayfa, Anasayfa
- Turkish near: Giris, Giriş, Baslangic, Başlangıç, Ana Menu, Ana Menü, Ana Ekran, Anasayfaya Don, Anasayfaya Dön
- English exact: Home, Homepage
- English near: Start, Dashboard, Main, Go Home, Back to Home, Back Home

Typos / guessing:
- If text has typos (not only minor; e.g., "Anasayfa", "Homeepage", "Hom", "Ansayfa", "AnaSafya", "Homepge"), infer the intended Home control using fuzzy matching (case/diacritics-insensitive; allow small edit distance and transpositions).
- When exact text is unclear, rely on attributes like aria-label/title and data-component-content containing the normalized idea of Home (TR/EN).
- Prefer selectors that are robust to whitespace and encoding differences (normalize-space(.), contains @data-component-content with encoded text).

Icon-only / symbol-based Home control (important):
- Treat an icon-only control as Home when the clickable ancestor (<a> or <button>) contains an <svg> or <i> whose class/name/aria suggests Home/House (e.g., classes "lucide-house", "lucide-home", "icon-home") or has data-lov-name="Home" / data-component-name="Home".
- Prefer targeting the clickable ancestor (<a> or <button>) that wraps the icon; do not target the raw <svg> alone.
- Example selectors:
  • css:button:has(svg.lucide-house)
  • css:a:has(svg[class*='house' i]), css:a:has(svg[class*='home' i])
  • xpath://*[self::a or self::button][.//svg[contains(@class,'house') or contains(@class,'home') or @data-lov-name='Home' or @data-component-name='Home']]

Element choice & diversity (very important):
- PRIORITY when choosing an element:
  1) <a> link to site root or home (href='/' or contains '/home', '/anasayfa', '/index').
  2) Header logo link (an <a> wrapping a logo image/text, or [aria-label*='logo']).
  3) Breadcrumb first item labeled Home/Ana Sayfa.
  4) Top navigation link labeled Home/Ana Sayfa.
  5) Button or icon-only control that clearly indicates Home (e.g., a house icon).
- If feedback shows previously tried selectors, DO NOT return the same DOM element again. Choose a different element that likely goes Home (e.g., logo link, breadcrumb, navbar item).
- Only propose alternatives for the chosen element; across attempts, pick a different element when feedback indicates failure.

Choosing rules:
- Prefer a visible primary navigation control clearly returning to the main page.
- If multiple exist, prefer exact "Ana Sayfa" or "Home" over "Back to Home" when both are present.
- Avoid controls for reset/submit/onboarding unless explicitly labeled Home.

Selector rules:
- Allowed selectorType: text | css | xpath.
- If exact visible text matches a synonym (e.g., "Ana Sayfa"), use selectorType="text" with that exact text. If icon-only, prefer css/xpath targeting the clickable ancestor with the icon descendant.
- Provide up to 10 alternatives for the SAME element (aim for 8–10 when possible), such as:
  • xpath://button[normalize-space(.)='Ana Sayfa']
  • xpath://*[self::a or self::button or @role='button'][contains(normalize-space(.), 'Ana Sayfa')]
  • css:[data-component-name="Button"][data-component-content*='Ana%20Sayfa']
  • xpath://*[contains(@aria-label,'Home') or contains(@title,'Home')]
  • css:button:has(svg.lucide-house)
  • xpath://*[self::a or self::button][.//svg[@data-lov-name='Home' or @data-component-name='Home']]
- All selectors MUST be derivable from the provided HTML; do not invent ids/class names.

Feedback usage:
- Treat feedback selectors as already tried. DO NOT return the same selectors or trivial variations (case-only/whitespace-only).
- More importantly: avoid re-targeting the same DOM element as in feedback; pick a different plausible Home element following the priority above.
- Prefer meaningfully different selectors (by structure/attributes) that increase success odds.

Output STRICT JSON only (one object), no markdown fences, no prose:
{
  "selectorType": "css|xpath|text",
  "selector": "<string>",
  "alternatives": ["<string>", "..."],
  "rationale": "<short reason>"
}

Example if a visible button reads Ana Sayfa:
{
  "selectorType": "text",
  "selector": "Ana Sayfa",
  "alternatives": [
    "xpath://button[normalize-space(.)='Ana Sayfa']",
    "css:[data-component-name=\"Button\"][data-component-content*='Ana%20Sayfa']",
    "xpath://*[self::a or self::button or @role='button'][contains(normalize-space(.), 'Ana Sayfa')]"
  ],
  "rationale": "Visible primary navigation labeled 'Ana Sayfa' or 'Home' navigates home; different from prior attempts if they failed"
}

letLLMMap_goUserTask.defaultPrompt:
You are an expert web UI analyzer. Given filtered HTML and a target user task label (provided separately), identify the single control that opens that task/page.

Guidelines:
- Consider exact/near matches in visible text, aria-label/title, and data-* (e.g., data-component-content with URL-encoded text).
- Prefer the clickable ancestor (<a> or <button>) containing the label/icon. Do not target raw <svg> alone.
- Allowed selectorType: text | css | xpath.
- Return STRICT JSON only: { "selectorType": "css|xpath|text", "selector": "<string>", "alternatives": ["<string>"], "rationale": "<short reason>" }.

extraSelectors.value: //button[contains(translate(., 'HAYAT SIGORTASI', 'hayat sigortasi'), 'hayat') and contains(translate(., 'HAYAT SIGORTASI', 'hayat sigortasi'), 'sigorta')]

llm.mappingPrompt:
You are an expert web UI analyzer. Task: Given filtered HTML of an insurance form page and extracted ruhsat JSON (vehicle registration), decide if this is a fillable form page or the final activation page.

If fillable, return a JSON with keys: page_kind='fill_form', field_mapping (map logical keys to selectors), and REQUIRED actions array (button texts like 'Devam', 'İleri', 'Continue', 'Next').
If final activation page, return page_kind='final_activation' and actions containing visible final CTA texts (e.g., 'Poliçeyi Aktifleştir').

VERY IMPORTANT mapping rules:
- Include ONLY fields that are present on THIS page.
- Each field_mapping selector MUST point to exactly one input/select/textarea (unique). Avoid container/form selectors.
- Prefer stable CSS in this order: #id, tag[name=...], then a unique data-* attribute that exists on THIS page (e.g., [data-testid=...], [data-qa=...]), then [aria-label=...], placeholder/title if unique. Use XPath only if no unique CSS is possible.
- Do NOT assume any site-specific attribute names; only use attribute names that are actually present in the provided HTML.
- Do NOT fabricate selectors. If unsure a unique selector exists, omit that key.
- For actions, ALWAYS scan for buttons with text content like 'Devam', 'Continue', 'Next', 'İleri', 'Submit' - these are CRITICAL for form progression.
- Actions should contain the visible text content of buttons, never CSS selectors.

SPECIAL FIELD MAPPING RULES:
- model_yili (model year): MUST map to an INPUT field that accepts year values (like 2024, 2005), NOT to vehicle type dropdowns.
- plaka_no: Look for input fields labeled 'Plaka' or with 'plate' in labels.
- motor_no: Look for input fields labeled 'Motor' or 'Engine Number'.
- sasi_no: Look for input fields labeled 'Şasi', 'Chassis' or 'VIN'.
- Examine labels carefully - model year inputs have labels like 'Model Year', 'Model Yılı' while vehicle type dropdowns have labels like 'Kullanım Türü', 'Vehicle Type'.

CRITICAL: If you see any buttons with text like 'DEVAM', 'Continue', 'Next', you MUST include them in the actions array.

Output STRICT JSON only with keys: {page_kind, field_mapping?, actions?, evidence?}.
